sinks.sink_id: settings_changed: power, LE, discoverable, bondable handling
sinks.sink_description: Adjusts adapter runtime behavior and system state (power on/off, scanning, discoverability, bondability), emits D-Bus property changes, persists settings, and may terminate the daemon based on new adapter settings.

required_conditions.description: The caller or source of the new 'settings' value must be an authorized, trusted MGMT/controller event path (not arbitrary external input).
The global D-Bus connection used to emit property changes must be initialized and valid before emitting signals.

The provided btd_adapter instance must be a valid, initialized adapter object with consistent fields (path, current_settings, pending_settings, adv_manager, etc.) before modifying its fields or using them to drive behavior.
The global powering_down flag and adapter_remaining counter, which control when btd_exit() is called, must only be set/modified through authorized shutdown logic.

Persisting discoverability-related settings via store_adapter_info() must write only to intended storage locations with appropriate filesystem permissions, not allowing unprivileged modification by external users.
